abstract: Voyager 2 and her sister Voyager 1 were launched, respectively, in August and September 1977. The object of these spacecraft was to conduct exploratory investigations of the Jupiter and Saturn planetary systems and the interplanetary medium between Earth and Saturn. In April 1978 the Voyager 2 redundant receiver and the loop capacitor in the prime spacecraft receiver failed, leaving the Voyager Project with a major problem: how to communicate with the spacecraft and get the data back.
title: Improved downlink frequency calculations for Voyager 2

organization.name: Jet Propulsion Lab., California Inst. of Tech.

publications.publicationName: The Telecommun. and Data Acquisition Progr. J.

related.title: The Telecommunications and Data Acquisition Progress Journal
